Md Nahid Hasan

Oxford, OH · (513) 807-5111 · nahidhasanraju1999@gmail.com

Graduate Teaching Assistant at Miami University, pursuing an MS in Computer Science with a 4.0 GPA, specializing in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Reinforcement Learning. I develop scalable multi-agent systems, including a deep Q-Learning–based urban delivery platform (QuikDel) and human activity recognition ML pipelines. During my research internship at the University of Dayton Research Institute, I applied real-time TDDFT, DFT, and NTO analysis to simulate electron dynamics in DNA, building reproducible Python workflows for molecular modeling and visualization. Previously, as a Software Engineer at Samsung R&D, I delivered mobile app features to 10M+ users and enhanced product stability through improved unit testing. Passionate about combining AI, distributed systems, and computational modeling to design intelligent, high-impact solutions.

Experience

Research Intern

University of Dayton Research Institute (UDRI)

Project: DNA as a Quantum Computer — Quantum Computing & Molecular Simulation

Investigating how DNA base pairs can represent and manipulate quantum information by modeling electron dynamics with modern quantum-chemistry techniques and producing robust analysis pipelines.

  • Apply RT-TDDFT, DFT, and Natural Transition Orbital (NTO) analysis to model time-resolved electron dynamics
  • Develop Python workflows for parsing, analyzing, and visualizing volumetric molecular data
  • Build reproducible simulation pipelines using PySCF, NumPy, and Matplotlib for real-time visualization
  • Create publication-quality figures and datasets for collaborative research and manuscript preparation

Keywords: Quantum Computing, Computational Chemistry, Molecular Simulation, Electron Density, PySCF

May 2025 – Aug 2025

Senior Software Engineer

Samsung Research & Development Institute, Dhaka, Bangladesh

Led feature development for Galaxy Wearables ecosystem, progressing from Software Engineer to Senior Software Engineer while delivering production-ready modules serving millions of users worldwide.

  • Designed and implemented critical features (About Galaxy Wearable, About Watch) for Galaxy Watch 7 mobile application
  • Enhanced unit test coverage of WearOS plugins, resulting in measurable reduction in production regressions
  • Collaborated with cross-functional teams including QA, Product, and Design to deliver high-quality user experiences
  • Mentored junior developers and contributed to technical architecture decisions
Jun 2024 – Jul 2024

Software Engineer

Samsung Research & Development Institute, Dhaka, Bangladesh

Developed and maintained features for Galaxy Wearable ecosystem with focus on user experience, platform integration, and code quality improvements.

  • Improved unit test coverage and CI-tested components, leading to faster stabilization cycles

QuikDel

MSCS Thesis Project

A scalable hierarchical multi-agent system for urban delivery optimization using Deep Q-Learning. Achieved 25% reduction in travel distances while processing 13,866+ delivery requests per hour.

Quantum DNA Computing

UDRI Research Project

Research prototype exploring DNA as a computational model for quantum systems using RT-TDDFT and molecular simulation techniques for quantum information representation.

Research Project

Analysis of Urban Sprawl Using Remote Sensing

GIS & Remote Sensing Research

Investigated urban sprawl in Dhaka City from 2013 to 2023 using Landsat 8 satellite imagery. Applied spectral indices (NDBI, SAVI, MNDWI, IBI) revealing 63.02% urbanization in a 691.51 sq km study area.

Remote Sensing GIS Satellite Imagery Urban Planning
View Code

Neural Processing of Emotional Musical Stimuli

fMRI & Depression Research

Analyzed brain functions in depressive vs non-depressive subjects using emotional musical stimuli and fMRI. Applied PCA and SVM classification on BOLD signals, achieving best accuracy with Occipital Pole ROI.

fMRI Neuroscience SVM BOLD Signals
View Code

Deep Learning-Based Road Skeletonization

Deep Learning Project (Collaborative)

Developed U-Net-based model to extract one-pixel-wide road skeletons from thick and noisy road images. Achieved 0.87 Dice score and 0.79 IoU using combined BCE+Dice loss on OpenStreetMap data.

Deep Learning U-Net Semantic Segmentation Computer Vision
View Code Team Project

Feistel-Based Cryptographic Algorithm

Cryptography Implementation

Implemented custom Feistel cipher with 32-bit key, LFSR-based key scheduling, S-Box transformation, and P-Box permutation. Features reversible encryption/decryption with comprehensive documentation and testing.

Cryptography Feistel Network LFSR Python
View Code

Interests

My research interests span across the intersection of artificial intelligence and real-world problem solving. I am particularly passionate about developing scalable AI systems that can address complex logistical challenges, from urban delivery optimization to intelligent transportation systems. My work in reinforcement learning and multi-agent systems aims to bridge the gap between theoretical AI research and practical applications.

Beyond traditional AI applications, I am deeply fascinated by the emerging field of quantum computing and its potential applications in computational biology. My upcoming research at UDRI explores the novel concept of using DNA as a quantum computational model, which represents an exciting convergence of biology, chemistry, and quantum information science.

In the software engineering realm, I am committed to developing robust, scalable applications that serve millions of users. My experience at Samsung taught me the importance of user-centric design, comprehensive testing, and the challenges of maintaining high-quality software at scale.

When I'm not immersed in research or coding, I enjoy exploring the latest developments in technology through tech blogs and research papers. I am also passionate about mentoring fellow students and contributing to open-source projects. I believe in the power of collaborative learning and enjoy sharing knowledge with the broader tech community. In my free time, I like traveling to experience different cultures and gaining new perspectives that often inspire creative approaches to technical problems.
